title: Spotted Animals
provenance_text:
Constant [1920-2005], Amsterdam, Netherlands and Paris France, until March 26, 1953; Hanny, probably Hanny (or Hannie) van Eyck [b. 1918], March 1953 [1]; lent to Stedelijk Museum, Amsterdam, Netherlands [2]. Court Gallery, Copenhagen, Denmark, until October 1968; purchased by Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1968 [3].

Notes:
[1]. As per inscription "voor Hanny 26/3/'53" on bottom center of the drawing. According to correspondence with Constant's wife Trudy Nieuwenhuys-van der Horst of the Fondation Constant in November 2016, "Hanny" is probably Hanny van Eyck, the wife of the architect Aldo van Eyck, a friend and colleague of Constant. She is also known as Hannie van Eyck-van Rooijen.
[2]. According to the Constant archive (see correspondence in note [1].)
[3]. The drawing was accessioned on October 16, 1968.
